div.sent: In their physical, mental and social development playing materials play an important role.
Toys made of cloth, light smooth wood, soft rubber etc. are safe for the babies.
Toys must be colourful and the colour must be fast.
It should be light.
Cutting out all sides with a scissors.
Then keeping the shape intact it should be closed with back-stitch.
On any side 2.5 cm space is to be kept for turning it inside out.
Then turning it inside out.
After turning cotton or small pieces of cloth are stuffed to give shape of the doll.
After stuffing cotton tightly, the cloth on the open-end side is to be folded inside and closed by stitching.
Then eyes, nose, face, hair etc. are to be drawn with black colour or black thread.
Those babies who normally remain sitting or sleeping for them rattles are suitable.
All type of rattle must have certain specialities like: It will ring and produce sweet sounds.
The handle should be smooth and round so that it may not hurt the baby's hand.
It must be made of cloth, smooth soft cane and rubber or light smooth wood.
It should not be large or heavy.
Procedure for making rattle: Take a smooth thin round cane of 87cm in length.
A circle of 20cm diametre has to be made at the middle of the cane.
Excluding the circle, equal length of cane has to be kept on both sides for the handle.
Portions of the cane on both the sides have to be brought together and tied tightly with coloured thread.
The handle has to be covered completely with the same binding.
Length of the rattle's handle will be 12 cm.
To make the binding smooth and soft coloured or printed soft cotton cloth can be wrapped around it.
Like the handle the circular portion is to be wrapped with thread or cloth.
In the blank space between two ornamental bells coloured ribbons are to be hanged.
In the kitchen various kinds of activities are performed at the time of cooking like cutting, washing, cooking serving etc.
Metallic utensils of various kinds are used for these jobs.
Measuring utensils- Teaspoon, tablespoon, cup, glass, and one set measuring utensils.
In the kitchen utensils made of aluminium, stainless steel, glass, iron, melamine, bamboo, wood, earth etc. are used.
But for cooking aluminium utensils are mostly used.
Deep fry pan of iron is suitable for frying.
There is a possibility of food becoming toxic if sour-tasting food is cooked in iron or copper pot.
All utensils should be washed cleanly and dried after use.
If rubbed with ash and then washed with soap and water, aluminium utensils remain clean.
Stainless steel, glass, melamine, bamboo and cane utensil, become clean with soap and water.
Hot water and soap is to be used for removing oil from utensils.
After washing, all kinds of utensilis are to be kept in the rack or shelf.
By this water is drained easily.
These are readily available when needed.
Some utensils are used occasionally.
So those should be wiped and kept clean for future uses.
Some fruits and green vegetables are used in salad and eaten raw by us.
But most of the foods are eaten after cooking.
To make the foods easily digestible Fish, meat, vegetables, rice, pulses when eaten after cooking well are digested easily.
More nutritive value is found in the food.
To enhance the taste, smell and nutritional value of foods-Different ingredients and spices are used in cooking food.
So the taste, smell and nutritive value of food increase.
Besides this food's essence comes out and increases the taste and smell due to cooking.
The foods are cooked by different procedures.
When we cook we must keep in mind that the nutritive value of each food should remain at the maximum.
Before cutting vegetables are to be washed.
They are to be cut in pieces as big as possible after peeling.
Vegetables should not be kept open for long time after cutting.
It must be put on the oven for cooking.
In-cooking vegetables small quantity of water is to be used.
The water should not be drained after boiling.
Foods are to be cooked in the covered pan.
Food should be kept on the oven for the time as needed to be cooked.
If food is cooked for a longer period the colour, shape, smell and taste change.
Besides this diminishes the nutritive value of food.
Vitamins of rice dissolve in water.
So rice should not be washed many times and its starch should not be drained.
It should not be stirred excessively when cooking food.
When cooking the person should wear her clothes tightly.
The hair should be tied securely.
The best habit is to wear apron while cooking.
If sharee's end, modesty scarf, ribbon of hair are kept disorderly then there is possibility of catching fire.
Cotton pad or potholder should be used while taking down the pot from the oven.
Modesty scarf or saree's end should never be used for this purpose.
It should be covered with the lid when oil in the frying pan catches fire.
Never pour water on it.
When cooking is over the oven should be turned off.
Desire and all satisfaction of eating depends upon neat, clean and orderly serving of foods.
Besides due to attractive serving, ordinary foods become tasty.
For serving food the place and necessary utensils should be washed and .wiped
According to menu necessary utensils should be available for serving foods e.g.
Foods on the table are to be arranged in proper way.
There should not be any difficulty in reaching the required dish.
Glass full to the brim with water should not be placed on the table.
The water may spill and spoil the table.
While filling the glass with water top 2-3 cm. of the glass should be kept empty.
The server should always serve the food from the left side.
Low level flower vase should be kept on the table.
The flower vase should not block the faces of those seated around the table.
When the meal is over, all utensils should be removed in a tray.
Necessary utensils like glass, plate, spoon, napkin should be placed on both sides of the table in buffet system.
Serving dishes are also to be placed on both sides of the table so that these are easily accessible.
Buffet system is better when number of persons is more and the space is small.
Because more chairs are not required for sitting in this system.
Normally people eat food standing.
In case of need few chairs can be placed in one corner of the room.
We use liquid food like; sherbat, coconut water, juice etc. besides pure plain water for meeting bodys need of water.
These are called drinks.
Drinks are very useful during summer, Ramadan and fever.
Lemon should be washed and cut into pieces.
The lemon seeds are to be removed.
Juice is to be extracted by squeezing with hand.
Water and sugar are to be mixed with the lemon juice.
It can also be served by putting ice chips.
Then it is to be strained with a bamboo or wire strainer.
If it is very thick then more water is to be added.
Curd is to be whipped.
Milk or whipped curd is to be mixed.
After mixing rose water and ice chips, the wood apple sherbat is ready to be served.
Many people like the sherbat without rose water and milk.
Peel the green mango and slice it.
After mashing the mango slice juice can be extracted.
3 cups of water and 1 cup of sugar or syrup are to be mixed with the mango juice.
A little colour is to be added before serving.
Mango sherbat is to be served after adding ice.
Cold water and syrup are to be mixed after whipping the curd.
Less of syrup or sugar is to be mixed if the curd is sweet.
To be served after putting ice chips.
If desired little salt can be added.
It will make 2 servings.
Snacks are sered normally in the morning and sometimes in the evening.
These are also made when guests come to the house.
Many time heavy foods are arranged as snacks.
Beside this light foods of various kinds are also welcome as snacks.
Recipes of some snacks are given below.
Boiled eggs are to be grated by a grater.
The cucumber is to be cut thinly or scraped by a scraper.
Tomato is to be cut thinly.
Except bread all ingredients and tomato are to be mixed together.
Mayonnaise is to be spread on two slices of bread.
On one piece of bread all the grated ingredients with eggs are to be spread with knife.
Over this the thin sliced tomato should be spread.
Then this is to be covered with the other piece of bread and then pressed with the palm of hand.
All sides of breads are to be cut evenly with a knife.
Then cut into halves or diagonally to give it the shape of sandwich.
From one pound of bread nearly 10 pieces of sandwich would be made.
It will make 10 servings.
After peeling the potatoes these should be cut in the chips cutting machine.
Besides potato should be sliced very thinly by a sharp knife if machine is not available.
The sliced potatoes are to be soaked in the salt water for 15-20 minutes.
When these are dried oil is to be heated in a fry pan.
Then all potatoes will be fried if bubble is appearing in oil.
Chips are to be taken out from oil by a slotted spoon when the potatoes are fried crisp.
Then placed on a paper, which absorb oil.
Some salt is sprinkled on potato chips.
After peeling the skin of potatoes these should be cut into finger size strips.
These should be soaked in salt water for some time after cutting.
After 10-15 minutes these should be taken out of salt water and then dried in the air.
Wiping with a cloth can make them dry.
Till the colour becomes light brown it should be deep oil fried.
Then taken out from oil and placed on a paper to absorb excess oil.
Hot french fry can be served with sauce.
It will make 3 servings.
Salad made from fresh fruits and vegetables are very useful for health.
Salad increases the appetite and brings variety in foods with polao quorma, rezala and biriyani on the table.
Besides, coloured vegetables and fruits mixed salad increases the elegance of the table.
Salad contains green citric fruits and vegetables.
So vitamin C and other food components are found in it.
After peeled off many fruits and vegetables turn brown in contact with air.
These will not turn browning if mixed with salt water, lemon juice or sugar syrup.
Banana, papaya, guava and apple are to be cut into small pieces, and then kept after mixing with lemon juice.
Hog-plum is also to be sliced.
All vegetables are to be peeled and sliced or cut into small pieces.
Lettuces are to be washed with water.
Onions should be cut into rings.
Green chillies and coriander leaves should be minced.
Spread the lettuce on a plate.
Mix salt with all sliced vegetables and place on the lettuce.
Prepared cut onions, coriander leaves and green chillies are to be sprinkled over the vegetables.
The dress of a new born should be single cut and stitched very simply.
It should be made of soft cotton and should be loosely fitted.
In this type of dress the baby will feel ease and comfort.
The material should be selected from cotton, handloom, voil, linen, mono colour or softly printed cloth etc.
The drafting and the details to make a simple dress for a new-born are given below .
Cloth-35cm, pencil, rubber, measuring tape, scale, shape stick, pin, needle, scissors, thread, sewing machine etc.
To make a dress of single cut there is no need of brown paper.
We can take the measurement of the body and cut it forthright.
At first the two sides of the girth should be stitched.
Piping should be fixed in the armpit.
AC and BH should be folded for 2 cm. and should be hemmed or stitched.
In this fold a long ribbon has to be inserted.
The bottom of the length should be folded 2.5 cm. and hemmed.
Nappies are used for the new born babies instead of panties.
Because it is easier to put on and change.
To make this nappy a 35 cm.
square piece of cloth should be taken and folded diagonally.
Then broad piping should be fixed by stitched on all the sides of clothes.
A loop should be made and stitched in the point B as shown on the figure.

In our daily life we use various types of stitching work.
The work is done by various type of stitches.
A proper stitch increases the beauty of a particular work enormously.
Designs are made on frocks, sarees, tablecloths, tray cloths and pillow covers by using different types of stitches.
Needle, thread of various colours and a frame are needed for work of embroidery.
Of all hand made stitches this is the easiest one.
Our traditional quilts are made by using this type of stitch.
In making dress with the help of run stitch the temporary stitch that is used is known as tuck stitch.
For example, tuck stitches are used to join two pieces of cloth or in stitching pleats.
To hem, at first anchor your thread in a seam allowance area and working from right to left side.
It will be made on the inside of the clothes.
Then insert the needle from the back of the stitch and take out the needle in front of this stitch.
Thus the stitch has to be continued gradually from back to forward.
In the surface this stitch looks like the machine stitch.
Take the needle from the edge of the thread to the front.
Then make a loop around the needle and then pull it up.
The next stitches will be formed in the same manner.
This way make other loops around the needle and then pull those up.
It looks like a chain so this stitch is called chain stitch.
It is used in filling the stems of different designs.
In between two lines on the cloth the needle has to be moved diagonally from left to right side.
The same stitch has to be repeated from right to left side along the same lines.
As a result in a row full of cross- stitches are found.
This stitch is used in making different designs on hessian, cellular cloth, prayer mat, bags, cushion covers, strainers etc.
This stitch is like buttonhole stitch.
At first insert the needle from the reverse surface of the cloth.
Then wrap the thread 3 or 4 times around the needle.
Pull the needle holding the twisted thread as a knot with your right hand finger.
Then pull the needle back through the fabric close to the previous stitch.
This stitch looks like a knot.
So it is called a knot stitch.

Then fill the entire place with repeated stitches from inner side and outer side.

The design can be worked in the centre or in one corner of the cloths.
